trustfund:
TF050516-PHRD-BURKINA FASO: POVERTY
            REDUCTION SUPPORT CREDIT III (PRSC),TF033969-AFRICA REGION - ROCK, PHOSPHATE

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Poverty Reduction Support
            Operation (PRSC-3) for Burkina Faso provides an analysis of
            the potential environmental and social impacts. The
            government's objective is to maintain a sound
            macroeconomic environment, and accelerate growth by
            providing external resources for the execution of the
            government's 2003 budget. There will be anticipated
            impacts, and mitigating measures. The potential
            environmental and social impacts are those resulting from
            its sectoral coverage. The potential environmental and
            social impacts can only be descried in generic terms. The
            rural development operations envisaged fall under two
            categories. The first category concerns the development of
            actions susceptible to encourage agricultural
            diversification. The second category of activities includes
            those associated with the liberalization of the cotton
            sub-sector. Diversification may improve soil fertility
            management and reduce the need for insecticide use. The
            activities supported under the basic health sector
            development evolve around strategic policy reforms aimed at
            more effective targeting of the poor for the delivery of
            basic services, institutional strengthening and
            decentralization of service provision, and human resource
            strengthening. The potential environmental aspects
            associated with the intensification of agricultural
            production will promote conservation practices that will
            help maintain the productive capacity of the resource base.
            Control of pesticide related pollution, and hazards. The
            government will support the promotion of alternative and
            complementary ways of pest management.
